hive_lesson.title: 1420 The Home of ELLLO
hive_lesson.description: Learn the Todd's house in Japan.

hive_text_custom.text: : Hey, Todd, where do you live?
: I live on the east side of downtown
: Oh. Do you like it there?
: I do. I live in an older house. But it's a big house, and it's really relaxing. It's a nice place to live.
: Wow. Sounds nice. How many rooms does it have?
: My house is pretty big. It's four rooms. It has a big sleeping room. It's a Japanese house. So it's not really a bedroom because you sleep on the floor.
But it also has a living room. It has, like, an office room and it has a kitchen.
: No, it's a pretty small kitchen and it's a very old kitchen. I have a small
. So it's very difficult to cook. But, you know, I have a
. I have a microwave. I have a nice kitchen table to eat at. So it's a pretty
: It sounds okay. What about your living room? What do you have in the living room?
: My living room, it's pretty cool for a guy because it's a good place to watch sports. I have a really big TV, and I have cable TV, so I get all the football channels.
: And I have a really big sofa, so I can sit on my sofa and watch sports and drink beer. It's great.
: Well, do you also have a nice bathroom?
: I do. I actually have three bathrooms.

: It's kind of crazy, yes. So in English, we say bathroom, but I have two rooms that are for the toilet and I have one room or the bathroom with the toilet for the guests. And then I have a bathroom that I used. And then also I have a natural
bath outside my house. So if I want to take a shower or bathe, I use that room.
: Wow. I'd love to have a hot spring at my house.
: Yeah, it's very nice. It's very, very nice.
: Does your house also have a yard?
: It kind of has a yard. So outside my house, there's an area for flowers and
or a garden around the house, but it's not a place you can play sports. There's no grass or anything. So it's a very, very small yard. But, you know, it's a nice place.
: Oh yeah. It sounds like a nice place to live.
: It is a nice place to live. I'm very, very lucky.
: You said you have a sleeping room, not a bedroom. What does that mean?

: Yeah. I live at a Japanese style house. So it's called the tatami room. And you sleep in the tatami room and you sleep on the floor on a futon. So I don't have a bed. So it's not a bedroom. It's a room that you sit in during the day and you can eat and talk with guests. But it's also a room that you sleep in at night. So yeah, I call it my sleeping room. 
But I think in Japan, they just call it the tatami room.
: Is it comfortable sleeping on the floor?
: Yeah, it's really comfortable. Now I love it. So before, I slept on a bed. But now I sleep on the futon on the floor and I really like it. Actually, I prefer to sleep on the futon on the floor.
: Well, it sounds like your house is really comfortable.
: It is. It is. I never want to leave.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 2) His living room is good place to _____.
3) How many places does he have to bathe?

hive_text_custom.text: A stove is used to cook food. Usually you can cook on an electric stove or on a gas stove with fire. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I cooked a stew on the stove.
 We loved to cook on the stove.

hive_text_custom.text: A refrigerator, or fridge, keeps food cool or cold. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
There is some soda in the fridge.
 I put the eggs in the refrigerator.

hive_text_custom.text: Here, decent means not great, but not bad. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
He earns a decent salary.
 That cafe serves decent coffee.

hive_text_custom.text: A hot spring is a pool of hot water that comes naturally from the ground. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
We soaked in the hot spring.
 The Japanese call hot springs onsens.

hive_text_custom.text: There's an area for flowers and
A bush is a short plant that has leaves like a tree. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
The ball disappeared into the bushes.
 His house has a wall made of bushes.

hive_text_custom.text: A yard is the space around a house with grass and plants. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I keep my dog in the yard.
 Her yard is so big we play soccer there.
